entry.title: üî¥ Enterprise in Motion: Event-Driven Architecture Use Cases for Innovation and Agility
entry.content: Discover how event-driven architecture (EDA) can transform enterprises. This session starts with a quick introduction to EDA, presents real-world use cases, explores common patterns, and offers practical tips for identifying EDA opportunities. Developers will learn how to leverage EDA for greater flexibility, scalability, and responsiveness in their enterprise projects.

entry.title: üî¥ Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the New Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content: In this session, we will introduce the new SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, event add-on for ERP. The overview will explain the value of the add-on when event-enabling SAP systems, when to use it, how to get started, and commercial aspects.

entry.title: üî¥ Hands-on Session: Practical Demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
entry.content: In this session, we will demonstrate how to configure events in the Event Add-on for ERP and send them to SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. You will learn how the add-on reacts to changes in the SAP system, turns them into events, and then seamlessly integrates with the broker, while benefiting from advanced features like Dynamic Topics and Async API specifications for Event Portal.

entry.title: üî¥ Seamless Side-By-Side Extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
entry.content:
An example on how to realize SAP‚Äôs strategy for clean core through side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build.
This session will provide an overview of the relevant capabilities from SAP Build, north star architecture and do a deep dive into how it is realized using SAP Cloud Application Event Hub. SAP Build already leverages this integration into supporting seamless integration with SuccessFactors and S/4 HANA. The presenters will go through how the journey looks from an end user and from an application provider‚Äôs perspectives. Details such as overall architecture and technical prerequisites will also be covered, including combining all the relevant pieces into a ‚Äúhow-to‚Äù integrate guide.

entry.title: üî¥ Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Join us for an immersive session that explores the power of event-driven and API-based automation using SAP Build Process Automation. In today‚Äôs connected enterprise, automation needs to be responsive, scalable, and tightly integrated with core systems like SAP S/4HANA and SAP SuccessFactors. This session offers a deep dive into the key enablers that make that possible.

We‚Äôll begin with an overview of API triggers, showcasing how external systems can initiate workflows through exposed APIs. Then, we‚Äôll uncover the power of Intermediate Message Events (IMEs)‚Äîan essential tool for designing asynchronous, API-driven processes.

You'll also gain insights into setting up the Unified Connectivity Layer (UCL) and Event Broker, forming the backbone for scalable event handling in SAP Build.

Through live demos, you‚Äôll witness two real-world scenarios:
üîπSales Order integration with SAP S/4HANA, demonstrating how APIs and IMEs work together
üîπSuccessFactors onboarding event trigger, where events initiate workflow via the SAP Cloud Application Event Hub setup

Whether you're a developer, architect, or business process expert, this session will equip you with the knowledge to build intelligent, integrated, and event-aware automations.

entry.title: üî¥ A(P)I: Unified Connectivity for AI Applications Using MCP
entry.content: This session will demonstrate how to connect AI-powered applications to external data sources, facilitating real-time AI-to-data integrations using a standardized mechanism based on the Model Context Protocol (MCP). We will explore key concepts of MCP, then put theory into practice with hands-on examples. Beyond exploring opportunities, applications and scenarios this technology enables, the session will also discuss typical operational challenges and security threats encountered when deploying and using MCP servers.

entry.title: üî¥ Open Resource Discovery ‚Äì How to build a well-connected metadata catalog across silos
entry.content:
Developers often face challenges understanding the IT system landscape: What systems exist, what services do they offer, and how can they be integrated? Open Resource Discovery (ORD) addresses this issue by providing an open-source standard for decentralized system descriptions. ORD details available APIs, events, data products, and AI resources, along with their contracts and documentation.

In this talk, we will explain what ORD is, the problems it solves, and why we created it. We will also discuss how SAP leverages ORD to publish a static catalog of offerings, enable real-time landscape introspection, and support products like SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Business Data Cloud, and SAP Build.

Additionally, we will present how we have built an ecosystem to simplify ORD adoption, helping developers identify issues earlier and improve the quality of metadata and documentation over time for both SAP and our customers.

Finally, we will share our current thinking on how ORD can benefit the AI ecosystem.

entry.title: üî¥ AI for Integration Excellence: Modernize, Optimize, Thrive
entry.content: In today's digital ecosystem, integration is not only strategic priority to connect fragmented IT landscape but a key-enabler of AI driven automated businesses. This session delves into the transformative power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in redefining iPaaS by boosting developer productivity, enhancing operational efficiency, and modernizing integration strategies. Participants will gain insights into SAP Integration Suite's recently released AI features as well as construe the AI roadmap and direction.

entry.title: üî¥ Partner Directory Accelerator Tool for Pipeline Concept - an SAP Open-Source Project
entry.content: Based on your knowledge about the Pipeline Concept, in this session, we explore the Partner Directory Accelerator Tool, available as SAP open-source project. Developed specifically for the Pipeline Concept, this tool accelerates the creation and maintenance of relevant Partner Directory content. Learn how to setup and use the tool and its key features, such as XSLT generation and replication of content in different tenants of a landscape.

entry.title: üî¥ Unleash Next-Generation Hybrid Integration with Edge Integration Cell
entry.content: Explore the latest innovations and roadmap of Edge Integration Cell, next-generation integration runtime of SAP Integration Suite for managing APIs and executing integrations within your private landscape. Discover how Edge Integration Cell empowers hybrid integration scenarios in on premise or private cloud environments.

entry.title: üî¥ SAP Cloud ALM - Integration & Exception Monitoring for SAP Integration Suite
entry.content: This session details how SAP Cloud ALM Integration & Exception Monitoring supports SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) by providing visibility into message flows, detecting failed or delayed messages, and enabling root-cause analysis. Participants learn how SAP Cloud ALM captures exceptions, monitors performance KPIs, and delivers actionable alerts to streamline operations in hybrid integration landscapes.

entry.title: SAP CodeJam Roadshow LATAM 2025 - recap
entry.content:
And that's a wrap..... Together with @josh_bentley, @RichHeilman, @thomas_jung, @SavioMarques, @jessicademarchi and @caiograbalos, we did a few SAP CodeJams in Latin America - four different cities (S√£o Paulo üáßüá∑, Lima üáµüá™, Mexico City üá≤üáΩ and Bogota üá®üá¥), various meetups and even joined the SAP Inside Track in S√£o Paulo. As part of the roadshow, we run the Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and ABAP Cloud & ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model CodeJams. It is always great to meet community members where they are and learn about the challenges they face in the different project and how SAP products enable them to tackle these.

 

This is the 2nd roadshow we've done in the region, and what a great experience it was. It was great to meet in person many SAP community members that I've interacted with online in the past. As well as seeing some familiar faces in the locations that we visited in the 1st LATAM roadshow.

S√£o Paulo üáßüá∑

@josh_bentley already share a recap of the events in Brazil and the first event in Peru.... so go ahead and check out all the photos he is sharing in the blog post - https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam-discussions/sap-codejam-roadshow-latam-2025-the-first-half-recap-being-present-is-about/td-p/14173987 

Lima üáµüá™

This is the first time we've done CodeJams in Lima, hosted at the SAP office. It was great to meet the local community and lovely to enjoy some of the local cuisine and coffee :-). Thanks to everyone who joined, even though there was a holiday right in the middle of the week #PeruEsClave.

 

 

 

 

 

Mexico City üá≤üáΩ

Two amazing events hosted at the IBM offices in Mexico City. I got the opportunity to meet SAP Champions - @Sandra_Solis and @MariettaLopez, whom I've interacted with in the past but never before met in person. Also, Devtoberfest winners - @Sandra_Solis and @eamarce23. Thanks to IBM for hosting, looking forward to more events in Mexico :-). The day after the CodeJams we also had the opportunity to visit the Museo Nacional de Antropologia time and get some time to learn about the different Mexican indigenous cultures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

Bogota üá®üá¥

Last city part of the 2nd LATAM CodeJam roadshow. The day before the events, there was some time to explore the city a bit and visit the Museo Botero, as well as the Casa de Moneda. The events took place @ the SAP office in Bogota. It was great to catch up with various previous CodeJam attendees, as well as meet some more community members. Special mention to the large crew who joined the CodeJams from Globant (Bogota and Cali).... next time we will organise the event at the Globant office haha

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 


 

Personally, I always feel energised after connecting with the large Latin American SAP community and I know that it is also a great experience for the other advocates that have joined the roadshows. I'm already looking forward to next year and doing more CodeJams in the region.

entry.title: [CANCELLED] üá™üá∏ Event-driven integrations with SAP Integration Suite, AEM (Barcelona, Spain)
entry.content:
Apologies, this event has been cancelled.

This SAP CodeJam instance will be about Event-driven integration using SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. Join us for this 5-hour event of developer networking and hands-on learning in Barcelona, Spain. This CodeJam is part of the Code10 TechTalks 2025 event, which will take place on the same day after the CodeJam. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please register for the CodeJam here üëâ https://code10it.com/sap-codejam-barcelona-2025/. If you wish to attend the Code10 TechTalks 2025 event, make sure to let the hosts know via the registration form.  
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We will achieve an integration scenario like the one in the diagram below by the end of the CodeJam.

If you are interested in knowing what we will develop during the event, check out the Event-Driven Integrations with SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh GitHub repo -  https://github.com/SAP-samples/event-driven-integrations-codejam. The repository contains the details of the integration scenario we will go through during the event.

This free, hands-on, in-person event (not virtual) takes place Thursday, the 2nd of October 2025, in Barcelona, Spain, @ CINC - CINC Centre de Negocis, Coworking i Assessoria Barcelona - 22@ Poblenou, Carrer de Llull, 321, Sant Mart√≠, 08019 Barcelona, Spain. The event is kindly being hosted by Code10. Thank you! 

The instructor for this event is Developer Advocate Antonio Maradiaga.

There are essential prerequisites that every attendee must complete before arriving at the event location. You can find the prerequisites here: https://github.com/SAP-samples/event-driven-integrations-codejam/blob/main/prerequisites.md.

If you wish to attend, please indicate that using the "Yes" button in the Will you be attending?  box on this page. Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees for this event. In that context, if you indicate that you're attending and later realise you can't, please remove your name so that others get a chance instead. Thanks!

Location: CINC, Carrer de Llull, 321, Sant Mart√≠, 08019 Barcelona

entry.title: Re: The Unofficial SAP Community HTML Tags Documentation
entry.content: This is what's so great about the SAP community... community members just helping each other out. Thanks @Marian_Zeis for sharing.

entry.title: Re: The Unofficial SAP Community HTML Tags Documentation
entry.content:
This is a Claude artifact that can help convert Markdown to HTML compliant with the SAP Community HTML tags. It is not perfect, there are trailing p tags without the opening p tag, but it should work if you hit save twice :-).

https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/209a363e-c69e-4b63-8cbc-1d687f04ec1a

entry.title: üî¥ Designing understandable SAP BTP Solution Diagrams & contributing to the SAP Architecture Center
entry.content:
This session will empower architects, consultants, and SAP practitioners to design clear and engaging SAP BTP Solution Diagrams by leveraging the official SAP BTP Solution Diagram Guideline and contribute to the SAP Architecture Center. 

Participants will learn how to transform complex SAP architectures into understandable visuals using industry best practices, reusable templates, and make use of the official icon libraries for tools like draw.io and Lucid Chart. The session highlights the end-to-end workflow for submitting and creating new reference architectures through GitHub, encouraging attendees to become active contributors in shaping the future of the  SAP Architecture Center.

Key topics include:

  • Applying the SAP BTP Solution Diagram Guideline to ensure clarity and visual consistency
  • Selecting the right level of detail based on the audience and architectural complexity
  • Best practices for contributing new or improved architecture diagrams to the SAP Architecture Center using GitHub

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - Integration track sessions
entry.content:
We are days away from the first session of this year's Devtoberfest, our annual virtual celebration dedicated to the SAP developer community. Like previous years, there is a lot going on in the integration space, and as part of Devtoberfest 2025 we will have sessions covering the following topics: Architecture, AI, Event-driven Architectures, Tools for integration developers, open source and more.

As you might be aware, every track is assigned a unique day across the four weeks that Devtoberfest takes place and Wednesdays will be all about integration.

Devtoberfest 2025 sessions

You can find all the different tracks/sessions that are part of Devtoberfest here. You can filter all events by selecting the topic (label) you are interested in, e.g. integration üòâ.

Let me quickly share all the sessions that we will have as part of the integration track:

1st of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥Pipeline for Cloud Integration
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
  • 13:00 - üî¥ Designing understandable SAP BTP Solution Diagrams and contributing to the SAP Architecture Center
  • 15:00 - üî¥ IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)

8th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the new Event Add-on for ERP
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Hands-on session: practical demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
  • 13:30 - üî¥ Enterprise in Motion: Event-Driven Architecture Use Cases for Innovation and Agility
  • 17:00 - üî¥ Unleash Next-Generation Hybrid Integration with Edge Integration Cell

15th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Seamless side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
  • 13:30 - üî¥SAP Cloud ALM - Integration & Exception Monitoring in Context for SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)
  • 15:00 - üî¥ Partner Directory Accelerator Tool for Pipeline Concept - an SAP open-source project

22th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ AI for Integration Excellence: Modernize, Optimize, Thrive
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Future-proof your scripts in SAP Cloud Integration
  • 13:30 - üî¥ A(P)I: Unified connectivity for AI applications using MCP

Note: If you click on any of the times of the sessions above, you will download the calendar invite for the session.

So go ahead and RSVP to the different sessions you are interested in. Also, make sure to download the calendar invites so that you don't miss the session and you can get a chance to ask the speaker any questions that you might have about the topic.

Happy learning this Devtoberfest 2025!

entry.title: üî¥ Future-proof your scripts in SAP Cloud Integration
entry.content:
In this session, you will learn how new Design Guidelines checks enable you to ensure that your scripts are prepared for future upgrades. You will get to see the new functionality in action and get a sneak peek at what's coming next.

SPEAKER: Morten Wittrock
